meanings.definition: The act of saturating or filling with water.
meanings.sent1: After heavy rain, the waterlogging of the field made it impossible to play soccer.
meanings.sent2: The waterlogging in the basement caused damage to the stored boxes.
meanings.sent3: The waterlogging in the garden turned the soil into a soggy mess.
meanings.sent4: The waterlogging of emotions overwhelmed her heart.
meanings.sent5: The waterlogging of the sponge was evident as it dripped water when squeezed.

meanings.definition: The condition of being filled or saturated with water.
meanings.sent1: The waterlogging in the pipes led to a burst and flooding in the kitchen.
meanings.sent2: The waterlogging of the soil caused the plants to wilt from lack of oxygen.
meanings.sent3: The waterlogging in the bathtub made it impossible to take a relaxing bath.
meanings.sent4: The waterlogging of the sponge made it heavy and difficult to use.
meanings.sent5: The waterlogging of the riverbanks resulted in erosion and loss of vegetation.
